meanings.definition: A person who constantly complains or finds fault with something.
meanings.sent1: The gripers in the office always have something to complain about.
meanings.sent2: The group meeting was delayed by the gripers who kept pointing out flaws.
meanings.sent3: The gripers at the party made everyone laugh with their constant complaints.
meanings.sent4: Her little brother is a real griper, always finding something wrong with his toys.
meanings.sent5: The gripers in the movie theater ruined the film for everyone with their constant complaints.

meanings.definition: A tool or device used for holding or grasping something tightly.
meanings.sent1: The mechanic used a pair of gripers to tighten the bolts securely.
meanings.sent2: She reached for the gripers to hold onto the slippery handle.
meanings.sent3: The gripers in the toolbox were essential for fixing the broken chair.
meanings.sent4: His words acted as emotional gripers, holding her attention tightly.
meanings.sent5: The gripers on the climbing wall ensured a safe and secure ascent.
